hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Transition via 30-Day Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence >55%) with 30-day realized volatility below 40% and price consolidates within ±5% of its 20-day SMA for ≥10 days, a breakout above the consolidation range's upper bound on >1.5x average volume signals an imminent transition to BULL regime, with BTC outperforming ETH over the following 7 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended low-volatility consolidation in neutral regimes often precedes directional moves. Volume-confirmed breakouts from such compression tend to sustain as institutional flows enter. BTC typically leads in early bull transitions as capital rotates from stablecoins/altcoins.
entry_conditions: BTC price within ±5% of 20-day SMA for ≥10 consecutive days
BTC closes > upper bound of consolidation range (highest high of last 10 days)
Volume on breakout day > 1.5x 20-day average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: 7 days after entry OR BTC regime shifts to BULL (confidence >65%)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC closes back inside consolidation range

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to hold within 3 days >50% of the time OR BTC underperforms ETH during subsequent 7-day period in >45% of cases.
